definition[0]: something which someone has invented or has the right to make or sell, especially something that cannot legally be copied by other people
definition[1]: an idea, design, or artistic work which a person or organization has invented or created and on which they have obtained a COPYRIGHT, TRADEMARK, or PATENT
example[0]: The country’s indifference to  (=lack of caring about) copyright protection not only hurts foreign creators of intellectual property, such as software makers, but it discourages home-grown creativity too.
example[1]: Microsoft’s regional manager for intellectual property rights
